item.title: fail2ban and apache digest authentication
item.description: Although I don’t consider fail2ban something to rely on for security is just another piece of the puzzle when securing a server. When configuring fail2ban for a debian server I noticed that the defaults rules are missing failures if DIGEST is used for authentication instead of basic. I added the following to /etc/fail2ban/filter.d/apache-auth.conf: [[]client <HOST>[]] (Digest: )?user .* (authentication failure|not found|password mismatch) Restart fail2ban and try entering a wrong user/password while checking the fail2ban log.
